# THE NEW YORK TIMES

VOL. CLXXIII . . . No. 60,182 | 2:03 PM The New York Times Company TUESDAY, JUNE 11, 2024

# SECURITY COUNCIL ADOPTS U.S. PLAN FOR A CEASE-FIRE

# NEW ANALYSIS

# Macron Takes Huge Gamble After Setback

He Calls for Early Vote Amid Rise of Far Right

# BY NOGEO CHOEIN

PARIS — On the face of it, there is little logic in calling a election from a position of great weakness. But that is what President Emmanuel Macron has done by calling a “last-minute” majority election in France on the back of a handwring by the left.

The French President Rally de Mitterle Le Pen and her popular political party, the National Rally, in a crushing defeat of Sunday in elections that the European Parliament. Mr. Macron might have done otherwise. He might also have reshuffled his government, or simply offered some through stricter controls on migration, only by renouncing contested plans to tighten rules on immigration.
